column4: you won't need to compile seti as it's not available as source afaik - it's not free software - it's distributed in a binary only variant I beleive
having linux binaries is not the same as compiling....who knows what == binaries...
they certainly have linux binaries available for different architectures but if you're wondering why it's not in ubuntu's main repositories or debians it's because of the license.
why don't you look on their site, it takes 3 seconds :P running seti is as challenging as downloading the .tar, untarring it and then running the file
if your CPU is that speed then gnome 2.10 must really crawl! you should probably take a look at a lightweight alternative designed for low speed systems - such as blackbox, fluxbox, icewm and more
whichever dir you ran the command from
seriously, I find gnome a bit slow with a p4 3.2ghz and 1.5gb of ram :) I've installed it on some slower PCs and I will prob switch them away
well, if you tar -xvf the file it'll make the setiathome dir
where ever you want - though the home dir is the most usual choice
did you not untar the file? and want to move the dir rather than the file?
to be clear when we say home dir we mean *your* home dir, e.g. /home/<your user name>
really not sure what you mean? of course put it inside your home dir, isn't that what you've been trying to do?
